runs.comm: full, wide outswinger, very wide outside off, left alone
length ball on a fourth-stump line, blocked back to the bowler
fifth-stump line this time, Raza ignores it
goes wider of the crease, angles it closer to off stump, straightens it away. Still not close enough to make Raza play
excellent line, continues to probe that channel, and Raza continues to leave. For now
beauty. Angles it in, a touch closer to off than the previous two deliveries, gets it to straighten. Another good leave from Raza
a bit fuller, and Raza gets a big front stride in before leaving another ball alone. Excellent first over from Naveed.
back of a length outside off, angling in. Chakabva goes back and across to defend
straighter now, a touch too straight, and he shuffles across before tucking it off his pads to fine leg
outswinger on a good length outside off. Raza leaves again
this one starts on middle and leg and comes in off the pitch. Raza can't connect with the flick. Off his pad into the leg side
back of a length on off stump, blocked into the covers
fullish on off stump, flicked to short midwicket
full outside off and he drives firmly into the covers, nearly bounces over short cover but the fielder jumped in the air and managed to cut it off
back of a length now and Raza is a little late on his defensive push off the back foot. Inside-edges it, and it sneaks between his legs, runs towards fine leg
fuller now, on off stump, defended with the angle into the on side
full outside off, comes forward and punches firmly to mid-off
length ball on that fifth-stump line and Chakabva ignores it
back of a length on off stump, defended watchfully into the on side

Javed is celebrating what he thinks is a caught and bowled but that is straight off the helmet. Short ball and he went for the hook, came on quicker than expected and hit him flush on the badge and popped straight up. The fielders check on Raza to see if he's fine. He is.
back of a length on off stump and he jumps across to defend from a very open position
fullish outside off, a hint of swing away, gets forward and defends into the covers
full and wide and he throws his bat at it and slices it high over backward point and it rushes away for four
length ball on middle and off and he lets it come on before tucking it just wide enough of short midwicket to pick up a single
full, angling in towards off stump, Chakabva gets a solid stride out to defend towards mid-on
back of a length on off stump, blocked towards short cover
back of a length outside off, stands tall and carves that to backward point
short outside off and he doesn't exactly middle the pull but picks out the vacant deep square leg area to place it into
back of a length outside off and he opens his bat face to steer than down to third man
back of a length outside off, slapped away to third man
back of a length, straightens from a fourth-stump line, and beats Raza's uncertain poke
down the track comes Raza and once again he doesn't quite middle an aggressive shot. Goes hard and slices diagonally through the line, manages to clear the mid-off fielder
shortish, doesn't get up as much as Raza expects, and he ends up pulling from thigh height towards square leg
angled in towards leg stump, and Chakabva is a little late on his flick. Rolls towards square leg
length ball outside off and he comes forward to dab it to the left of backward point, who makes a diving save and stops the batsmen from taking the single
back of a length outside off, punched into the covers
back of a length, nips in a touch towards off stump and Raza defends awkwardly off the back foot
back of a length on off stump, punched to short extra cover
shot. That was angled in, cramping Chakabva for room, but he simply leaned away and opened his bat face to guide it wide of second slip
length ball on off stump, nurdled towards short midwicket
back of a length on off stump, pushed to mid-on with soft hands
shortish on off stump and he jumps across to half-flick, half-pull that towards square leg
back of a length, angling in towards off stump, and all Chakabva can do is hop and defend into the off side
outswing from back of a length outside off, and backward point is quick to move to his right and cut off the forcing push off the back foot
short ball, sits up, and he pulls it away to the deep backward square leg boundary, past the square leg fielder diving to his right
now he looks to go fuller and straighter and ends up sliding down leg
and again. This one slips even further down. That seemed to swing late towards the leg side as well
down the track now, and he skips inside the line to hit that inside-out over cover
now it's short and wide. Very wide. Raza has to reach out a long way to cut and he can't connect
short again, this time there's just enough width for Raza to get comfortably on top of the ball and cut it away in front of square
back of a length, curls away from off stump, punched into the covers
back of a length again and he opens his bat face to steer it to point
back of a length outside off, Chakabva stands tall and punches it to backward point
excellent bounce there. He banged it in and angled it in towards the batsman, who leaned his upper body out of the way to let it pass
fuller now and Chakabva moves forward to drive but his head isn't over the ball and he ends up slicing the drive towards third man
back of a length, angling in, and he goes back and across to defend into the on side
short, rising over off stump. Raza has to fetch that pull from well over shoulder height, and he does it very well, sending it soaring over the square leg boundary
back of a length on off stump and Raza jumps across into that open position to defend towards mid-on
length ball on off stump, no real turn, and he works it with the angle through midwicket
a bit of turn this time, towards leg stump to cramp Raza who was looking to make room. Ends up squeezing it off the back foot to mid-on
short and wide and he leans back to slap that to the cover point boundary
and now he sees a bit of air outside off and plants his front foot across to sweep it, bottom hand coming off the handle, up and over backward square. Excellent placement
a bit of loop and it lands on a good length outside off. Raza presses forward to block
full on middle stump and Raza looks to drive to long-on, but short midwicket sprints off the blocks quickly and dives to his left to stop the single
fullish, angling in towards off stump, defended towards mid-on
good ball, slippery bouncer angled into the body. Chakabva leans back to ramp it but it's past him before he can get his hands into position
back of a length, angling in towards off stump. Chakabva defends with soft hands, and the ball drops down into his pads
good line again, back of a length and no width outside off. Chakabva defends towards backward point
and again, excellent angle into the batsman, who stands there and punches it firmly into the ground, bounces up towards backward point
fuller now, angling in towards off and middle. Chakabva defends towards mid-on
length ball on off stump, defended towards mid-on
a bit of loop outside off and he leans over to lap-sweep it over his shoulder and into the gap to the right of short fine leg, who's stationed very square
back of a length outside off, Raza waits on it and dabs it to the left of short third man
length ball on off stump, clipped to short midwicket
a bit of turn towards leg stump, driven with an almost straight bat to deep midwicket
tossed up slow outside off and Raza presses a long way forward to poke that away towards point
length ball on off stump. Chakabva rocks back and cuts straight to point
a little fuller now and he shows the full face to push that down to long-on
back of a length, turning down leg, tucked off the hips to square leg
tossed up slow, down the leg side, and he sweeps it down to fine leg
fullish on off stump, driven down to long-off
gone! Completely against the run of play, a really soft dismissal. Goes back to cut, and it's possibly too close for that, and he ends up scooping it straight to backward point at midriff-height
Chakabva looks to run this down to third man with an open face, the ball beats his edge. Javed appeals for caught behind, twice.
slips down the leg side again and it's easily tucked away off the hips to the fine leg boundary
length ball, angling in towards off stump. Chakabva stays in his crease and tucks it into the on side
down the leg side again and Chakabva accentuates that by shuffling across his stumps, glances it down to fine leg
gentle, banana outswinger outside off. Masakadza leaves it alone
another away-curler wide outside off, and Masakadza raises his bat high above his head
round-arm, angling in towards leg stump. Chakabva closes his bat face too early and it pops up off the leading edge to the left of the bowler
full on leg and middle, clipped to short midwicket
tossed up on leg stump, and he can't beat short midwicket with that drive
now he tries to walk across his stumps and play the paddle sweep. Too far down leg to be able to connect
rocks back to a ball that is nowhere near short or wide enough to cut, ends up punching it back down the ground
uh, oh. That short, straight midwicket fielder is in play again as Chakabva goes back and punches towards him. He fails to get down quickly enough and it rolls between his legs to long-on
on the pads, tucked away towards deep backward square leg

got him! He's struggled through his last two overs but Javed has produced an excellent delivery to dismiss Zimbabwe's best batsman. It was threatening to curl away in the air and then it came in off the pitch and beat Masakadza's inside edge to hit him on the back pad, plumb in front. He was looking to drive that on the up through mid-off
and he's greeted with another wide down the leg side from Javed
on the pads again and Taylor clips it away towards fine leg, where Nasir puts in a diving stop at the rope
fullish on middle stump, clipped away towards deep square leg
full on off stump and he punches this with a straight bat to send it racing away into the gap between midwicket and mid-on. Lovely shot
length ball outside off. Chakabva waves it through to the keeper
looks for the bouncer, and that's another wide, for height this time. The batsman didn't even bother ducking, that's how high it was
back of a length on off stump, defended off the back foot
on the pads and he comes forward to flick it away towards deep midwicket
pushed through a bit quicker and he goes back to work it square on the leg side
a bit of air, shifts his line towards off stump, and Taylor presses forward to block it back to the bowler
length ball on off and middle, played with the turn towards square leg
a bit more air and he gets forward to drive that down to long-on
pushed through now, angling in towards the batsman, and he punches it straight to short midwicket
length ball on a fourth-stump line, Taylor defends watchfully back to the bowler
a bit of swing in towards the pads, clipped away through midwicket
fullish outside off and Chakabva looks to drive through extra cover, plays down the wrong line and gets a thick outside edge to short third man

ooh. That's a bit straighter and he goes for the drive down the ground, hits it uppishly. Karate reaches out with his right hand, gets a fingertip to it, and it narrowly misses the stumps at the other end, with Taylor out of his ground
now Taylor goes for the big slog-sweep from outside off, can't connect
length ball outside off, clipped down to long-on
Hits a nice length outside off and Taylor presses forward to defend
that's a lovely orthodox line but it's always problematic when third man is in the circle. Modern batsmen can reverse-sweep those all day and Taylor is as good as anyone else at playing that shot
tossed up outside off, a bit of drift in the air. Taylor clips it down to long-on
now Chakabva shuffles across outside off and lap-sweeps it over his shoulder towards fine leg
tossed up towards off stump, clipped to square leg
down the track now, flicks it away to deep midwicket
shortish on off stump, pulled to deep midwicket
shortish outside off, stops on the pitch and forces Chakabva to abandon the idea of cutting. Ends up flat-batting it down the ground to long-on
looks for the sweep, picks the wrong length, perhaps, and gets a top edge that loops over the keeper
wide outswinger and Chakabva is beaten. overbalancing a little trying to reach it to drive
back of a length on off stump, punched to short midwicket
shuffles across to try and sweep, is hit on the front pad. Only the keeper appeals, that clearly struck him outside the line of off stump
tossed up wide outside off and he goes for the sweep, hits it in the air but finds the gap between deep midwicket and deep backward square leg
length ball, turns towards leg stump. Chakabva skips away to make room and punches it to long-off
length ball, turns from middle and leg and slips down the leg side
loopy delivery outside off, comes forward to clip it to short midwicket
back of a length, turns in and cramps Taylor for room. Punches it straight to short midwicket
on the pads now and he can clip it away to the man at deep midwicket
length ball outside off and Taylor opens his bat face at the last moment to dab it into the gap to the left of short third man
back of a length on off stump, punched down to long-off
back of a length outside off, barely comes on, punched to mid-on
too straight now and he tucks it away off the pads towards deep backward square leg
fullish on middle stump, punched to short midwicket
slower ball on middle stump. Chakabva lets it come on, dabs it towards short fine leg
the captain has another wicket! Chakabva went on the back foot to work it into the leg side and slipped as he did so, and his feet slid straight into the stumps. Unfortunate dismissal.
tossed up outside off and he comes forward to drive that towards cover point
down the track now, clips it to that busy man at straight midwicket
out of his crease once more, this time he beats the close-in fielder to pick up the single to long-on
nice flight outside off, driven to short extra cover
a touch short and Williams skips back and punches it into the gap between cover and extra cover
length ball, angled in towards off stump, punched back past the bowler to long-off
flighted outside off and he leans across to lap it away towards fine leg
full on middle stump, clipped to midwicket
goes for the full-blooded sweep this time, it's a touch too full to middle, but he manages to drag it towards fine leg
full outside off, driven to extra cover
full on off, looks for the drive to long-off but the bowler falls across to get in the way
angles this in towards middle and leg and turns towards leg. Tucks it off the pads but he can't beat backward square leg
length ball on middle stump and he comes forward to defend
and again, the reverse-sweep to release the pressure. This one was more difficult than the previous one, took it from middle stump and hit it squarer
down the track now and he shows the full face to play the checked drive to long-on
tossed up outside off and he comes forward to defend to extra cover
floated up full on off stump, and he drives to that man at extra cover
flat and full on middle and off, defended back towards the bowler
full on middle and leg, Taylor makes room to drive inside-out, can't beat short cover
now he gives it some air outside off and Taylor welcomes the room to free his arms and swings them through a full arc to launch that for a straight six
slightly lower trajectory this time, outside off, and he drives it towards mid-off
down the track now and he shortens his length somewhat. Taylor defends into the off side
full on off stump, Taylor clips but can't beat the man at straight midwicket
tossed up outside off and he goes against the turn this time, but can't drive that past midwicket
sweeps from off stump now, down to deep square leg
poor fielding at the fine leg boundary from Javed, lets it slip between his legs after sprinting to his right to stop the lap-sweep from Taylor
short now and Taylor is quickly on the back foot to cut that away powerfully past Chandran, who makes a poor attempt at diving to his left to stop it
on the pads, nurdled away towards midwicket
full on off stump, driven firmly back to the bowler
lovely delivery, a bit of drift and dip and Taylor plays down the wrong line while trying to push that down the ground to long-off. Thick outside edge races away to the right of the keeper
straighter line now, defended off the front foot into the on side

given! That was too full to sweep, and it's hit him on the front pad. The umpire had a long think before giving it out, and Taylor has reviewed. That didn't turn, and may in fact have straightened the other way. Looks out to me. Certainly no inside edge on that. Pitches off, hitting middle and leg. He's a goner.
length ball on off stump, punched into the covers
length ball outside off and he comes forward to drive into the covers
full on leg stump, clipped past the diving straight midwicket fielder, down to long-off
goes back to a length ball, punches it back to the bowler
on the back foot again, looks for the punch down to long-on, bowler skips across to field it
a bit of air now and he comes forward to push it to the right of the short cover fielder
down the track comes Williams, drives it down to long-off
shortish, and he whips it away towards deep backward square leg
down the track, and he swings his arms through a long, free arc to launch that over the midwicket boundary
full on leg stump, clipped to short midwicket, who fumbles to allow them to run a second
another of those sliders, this time going through from back of a length outside off. Looks to punch and ends up playing inside the line
quickish on off stump and he goes back to punch it back to the bowler
fuller now, a bit slower as well, and he presses forward to drive it down to long-off
beauty. Another under-cutter, by my estimation, and Williams came forward to drive through the off side, ended up inside-edging onto his front pad
nice flight and Williams gets forward to drive to long-off. Aziz dives to his right and stops it
full-toss down the leg side, tucked away to the fine leg boundary. Nah, no bat. Thigh pad. Still a poor ball. Still four runs.
full outside off, driven to sweeper cover
full and wide and he drives it out to sweeper cover
fullish on middle and leg, punched with a straight bat to mid-on
back of a length on off stump, punched to sweeper cover
back of a length on off stump, gets on his toes and pushes it with soft hands towards short cover
length ball, sliding with the angle towards off stump, pushed down to long-on for one
shortish outside off and he flat-bats it hard, looking for long-off, but Aziz gets in the way to stop it
goes back to a length ball that keeps a little low, defends it back to the bowler with a straight bat
back of a length on off stump and he goes back to tuck it away to deep midwicket with the angle
full, gets some drift in towards the batsman's feet. He gets his foot out of the way and punches it  back to the bowler
length ball on off stump and he comes forward and opens his bat face to dab it to short third man

full ball, loud lbw appeal as it hits Mire on the base of his pads as he misses the leg-side flick, but that looked to be going down the leg side. They think about reviewing the not-out decision, decide against it. Wisely.
length ball, angling in towards off stump. Mire goes back and punches it down the ground, can't beat the straight midwicket fielder
shortish outside off and he goes for a full-blooded pull. Through his shot too early and inside-edges it into his thigh
got him! Lovely delivery from Naveed, curling away late from a nice length outside off. Mire goes for the drive on the up, away from his body, and edges it into the keeper's gloves
back of a length on off stump and he blocks it off the back foot into the off side
full outside off and that's a lovely drive, splits the gap between cover and mid-off
full on off stump, clipped down to long-on
sweeps now, from outside off. Wasn't quite the length for it and he dragged it straight to short fine leg
full on off stump, driven down to long-off
full on leg stump now, clipped to the right of short fine leg

length ball on off stump and he presses forward to push it with soft hands towards extra cover. Rohan Mustafa swoops down and throws at the bowler's end, misses by a long way, and gives up an overthrow as well
nice length outside off and he comes forward to block to short extra cover
good length ball around the off stump, slid to short third man
steps forward to a fuller ball and pushes it back at Chandran
tight on off stump, and that means Ervine can knock the ball back at the bowler only
manages to force to good length ball to long-off
hint of width on offer, but the line was fuller and threatening enough to make Williams shoulder arms
punched to long-off as the over concedes only two runs. Good time to recuperate with some drinks
flatter and on a good length on off stump, pushed back at the bowler
tossed up on leg stump, tapped down to long-on
flighted on off stump, Ervine leans forward and whips to long-on
right up there, targeting the base of middle stump and Williams can only drill it as far as long-on
risky ploy against a quicker, flatter ball that was following his movement outside leg. Crashed into the covers
that's neatly done, lunged forward to get to the tossed up ball on the full and sweep it very fine. Guessed the bowler's line and length and one-upped him
length ball on middle stump and the batsman makes room to hit through the off side, goes looking for long-off but extra cover moves to his left to stop it
on the pads now and Ervine simply flicks his wrists to send the pick-up shot soaring over the square leg boundary. Exceptional timing
a bit fuller, on the pads again, clipped towards deep backward square leg
length ball outside off, driven to extra cover
fullish outside off, dabbed to backward point with an open face
down the track now, gets inside the line to drive this down to long-off
full outside off, another single driven down to long-off
shot. Williams skips down the track again and frees his arms, swats it away, against the turn, to the straight midwicket boundary
down the track again, driven down to long-off
full on middle stump, clipped past straight midwicket down to long-on

down the track again and this one's a bit wider. Gets too close to the pitch of the ball and gets no elevation, almost ends up scooping a low catch to extra cover. I think that fell just short of the diving fielder
length ball outside off, clipped away to long-on
length ball outside off, driven to extra cover
length ball, sits up outside off, and he swats it away with complete ease over the wide long-on boundary. Boom.
full on middle stump, eased down the ground for another single to long-on
and now Williams joins in the fun. Right in his hitting zone, and he simply swings his arms through to go one bounce over the midwicket boundary
straightens his line a touch and he uses his wrists to manouevre that to the left of long-on to pick up two
fires it in full on off stump, punched back to the bowler
full again, this time he uses his bottom hand to whip it with the angle wide of long-on
yorker on leg stump, jammed down the ground to long-on
full on leg stump, clipped down to long-on
a bit of air now, on off stump, driven firmly but the bowler moves quickly to his right to stop it
short ball and he backs away from leg stump to make room and slap it over cover point for another boundary
full and wide, attacking the tramline and Williams has no option but to leave that alone
slanted across again, wide outside off, and the umpire exercises his arms again
back of a length outside off, dabbed down to third man
short ball, and Williams pulls it away dismissively to the midwicket boundary
slings it wide outside off again - I suppose this is a plan, but it's a terribly difficult one to execute, the margins are so small. Gives away another wide
fuller now and it's closer to the batsman, who drives it away to the left of the sweeper cover fielder

full on middle and off, and that's an elegant clip between midwicket and mid-on. The mid-on fielder moved to his left and got close to the ball, but he only managed to dive over it. That boundary brings up Williams' fifty, and it's been such an assured knock
length ball outside off, driven with an open face and point dives to his left to stop it
goes for the drive through the off side, and it may have straightened a little, hit the inside edge and rolled towards square leg
full outside off, and he eases it to the sweeper cover fielder, opening his bat face through the drive
in the blockhole on off stump, clipped towards short midwicket
full outside off, shows the full face to find mid-off
nice length, angling in from wide of the crease and straightening a touch. Williams plays a checked drive towards mid-off
back of a length outside off, dabbbed towards point
full outside off and he clips it with the angle to long-on
full and wide, gets down low to flat-bat that to long-off
full outside off, driven with a lot of bottom hand to the right of long-off
length ball on off stump and Ervine makes room to slap it away wide of point
on the pads, nurdled away towards deep square leg
length ball outside off, shows the full face to drive it to long-off
got him! Length ball on off stump, stops on the pitch and Ervine checks his shot and ends up popping a simple return catch
back of a length outside off, pushed back to the bowler from the crease
back of a length on a fourth-stump line, dabbed to backward point
full-toss outside off, pushed down the ground to long-off
length ball, tucking him up on a middle-stump line, clipped to short midwicket
fuller now, on off stump, punched back to the bowler
length ball outside off and he's beaten, flashing at it away from his body
length ball outside off, pushed into the covers off the front foot
full-toss outside off, heaved down the ground to long-on
length ball outside off, and he slaps it away towards deep point
length ball on middle stump, Chigumbura clips it but can't beat short midwicket
back of a length on off stump, no pace on it, punched back to the bowler
fullish legcutter on middle and leg. Chigumbura shows the full face to drive to long-on
back of a length outside off, and he can't time the punch through cover, ends up squirting it down into the pitch, rolls back towards the keeper
full outside off, driven down to long-off
length ball, comes in off the pitch and he tucks it away off the pads towards square leg
fullish outside off, driven down to long-off
fullish offcutter on off stump and Tauqir dives to his left at short midwicket to stop that swipe from Chigumbura
lovely shot. Finally he gets a bit of width and he waves his hands through this drive to place it between backward point and cover point
back of a length on leg stump. Tucks it off his pads but can't beat short fine leg
slower ball on off stump and he's initially surprised but quickly adjusts to chip it back over the bowler's head
full on middle stump and he makes room to drive it down the ground to long-off
length ball on middle stump and he goes on the back foot to punch it to short midwicket
slower ball, but lots of width outside off, and he stands tall and slaps it to the backward point boundary
another slower ball, closer to off stump this time, and he looks to flat-bat it towards long-on, but short midwicket moves quickly to intercept it
fullish on off stump, pushed to mid-off for a quick single
full on middle stump, driven down to long-on
short ball outside off, has to go against the angle to pull it. Doesn't quite time it but it drops safely near the midwicket boundary
short again, but this one's over leg stump, and he can easily swivel and swat it over the gap to the left of short fine leg
short again, this one sits up, and this is the best pull of the lot, cracked off the middle of the bat, in front of square, and races away to the straight midwicket boundary
what a glorious way to win it. It's a length ball on off stump and he simply shows the full face to send it skimming smoothly down the ground, past the stumps, and into the straight boundary
